document_data.name: Measuring Cord
document_data.mainbody: '''Measuring cords''' were [[rope]]s retrofitted for the purpose of measuring the width, length, and height of objects.
document_data.Description: These ropes were knotted at regular intervals to indicate lengths. On average they spanned {{SIrange|12|20|ft|long=yes}} in length.
document_data.History: In the midâ€“14{{th}} century [[DR]], measuring cords were a common variety of tool in the city of [[Waterdeep]].
document_data.Notable Users: * [[Felsharp]], the operator of [[Felsharp's Furniture]] in [[White Ford]], kept measuring cords on hand for his work.<ref>
